oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to Sarah Bell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page letter from Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to Sarah Bell. He discusses their correspondence, blames the lack of delivery on the post master, and hopes she feels better as she had written that she was unwell.; He mentions that the last battle, they took three thousand prisoners where Johnson was the Confederate commander in charge. He hopes he has not said anything to bother or trouble her. Owen was from Brownsville, Ill. and died Sept. 3, 1863.
